instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMC’s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no power
threads.message:
No water damage history-  no sign of drop.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.22v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42v
ppvrtc 3.42v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> AND <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> both missing. do i have a bad smc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no power
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.22v"
So SMC doesn't properly talk with <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

Post <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>.
Check basic signals and voltages for <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> (2 OF 2), page 35.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>  all 0v.

no green light i test pin 9 of j9500 voltage fluctuating constantly between 0.3v to 3.3v

around <CHIP>U5000</CHIP>:
L5001 3.3v present
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> 3.3v present
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDDC</SIGNAL> 1.2v present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no power
threads.message:
All <SIGNAL>SMC_TXX</SIGNAL> signals with high level?
If yes, put good flux and reflow SMC.
If still the same issue, reball it.
As last option, change SMC; donor board, same model required.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no power
threads.message:
NO, just DC voltage.
All 4 should be high...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no power
threads.message:
yes all good i reflow and green light AND fan spin.... power is the booting up chime --- but having wifi. i will test and report back..
thanks INFORMATICOS!!!
